result.execSummary:
The defendant Devale L. Carpenter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:20 a.m. Defendant Devale L. Carpenter appeared by phone. Prosecuting DA Louis Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court review Defendant's request of incarceration credits. Defendant makes statement of facts for consideration by the Court. BY THE COURT: 147 additional days are granted so the total will be 229 days credit and will amended the JOC to reflect this amount.
Sentence adjustment review on February 17, 2017 at 11:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Devale L. Carpenter
Current: PO Box 4000, c/o New Lisbon Correctional, New Lisbon, WI 53950 United States  (Effective: 06-22-2015)
Prior: 920 2nd Avenue S, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495 United States

Defendant Devale L. Carpenter in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Devale L. Carpenter in custody. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:18 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Amended PSI had been recieved by the Court and the parties.
Atty Molepske indicates that he had requested an amendment and states this on the record.
Per Atty Molepske the agent appears in Court today.
Atty Molepske indicates that victim notification had been complied with; no victim appears in Court today.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Wallace has no corrections other than what Atty Molepske had indicated on the record.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes statements prior to sentencing.
1:40 p.m.  Atty Molepske makes additional statements that the defendant had been in custody and states that the defendant could have pre-trial credit. 
Court goes over the payment of cash bond and trying to determine if any pre-trial incarceration credit.
Atty Wallace states that there are 82 days of credit.
**Both parties stipulate to the 82 days of pre-trial incarceration credit.
BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
*Sentenced to prison for 4 years with 2 years of initial confinement and 2 years of extended supervision
*Run concurrent with Wood County case(s)
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
*Not be on the premises of Ristey's Guns and Ammo Shop
*Pay restitution in the amount of $125 to Ristey's Guns and Ammo Shop - to be paid first.
*Provide DNA Sample if not already provided
*Maintain absolute sobriety while on extended supervision
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Be actively involved in AODA & comply with any aftercare treatment recommendations.
*Receive counseling for anger management
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent. 
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Prescription medication from one pharmacy. 
*Sign all appropriate releases for the DOC to monitor his medications as well as any treatment received from physician(s), psychiatrist(s) or psychologist(s)
*Pay court ordered financial obligations and supervision fees - victim witness/DNA surcharge
*Not eligible for the Earned Release and Challenge Incarceration Program.

Count 2 -
*90 day jail sentence to run concurrent to Count 1 and Wood County Case(s) 
*Pay fine of $300 
*Pay costs of Victim Witness/DNA Surcharge and filing fee 

Count 3 - DRI
Ad Prosequendum with attached Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum /a/ TTF 02/13/16
records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt:
Attorney John H. Wallace in court, defendant Devale L. Carpenter not in court, in custody. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:55 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 2 as repeat offender, contrary to the statutory sections stated therein.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 3 is dismissed and read-in. 

Court questions parties. 
Atty Wallace indicates there is a PSI from Wood County. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court orders the PSI prepared in Wood County is to be updated (previously done by Agent Ridgway) to include these charges and convictions.  
PSI to be completed by 3/3 with copies forwarded to counsel. 
Bond Continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
